availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
RICHARD YATES
STATE SOVEREIGNTY.
NATIONAL UNION
GOVERNOR OF THE STATE OF ILLINOIS,
To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

It appears by the annexed papers, duly authenticated according to the Laws of this State, that Arch Means stands charged in Richland County with the crime of Kidnapping and it has been represented to me that he has fled from the justice of this State, and has taken refuge in the State of Kentucky

Now, Therefore, Pursuant to the provision of the Constitution and Laws of the United States in such case made and provided, I do hereby require that the said Arch Means be apprehended and delivered to William L. Manson who is hereby duly authorized to receive him and convey him to the State of Illinois, there to be dealt with according to law.

In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused the Great Seal of the State to be hereunto affixed. Done at the City of Springfield, this 19th day of May in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty-four, and of the Independence of the United States the eighty-.

Richd Yates
BY THE GOVERNOR:
O. M. Hatch
SECRETARY OF STATE

Illinois
Requisition of Govr of Illinois for Arch Means
6th June /64
